intro: Zexmenia rudis, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to tolerate saline and arid conditions. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Zexmenia rudis typically grows in shallow water or on wet sand, making it a hardy species often found in maritime environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
